tags: to say he's only fighting for the north is too narrow
summary: Jon Snow is absolutely fighting for the realm.
title: Jon Snow is absolutely fighting for the realm.
body:
I’ve seen a couple people claim that Jon is only fighting for the North, which isn’t true. Yes, the North is his home, and he’ll defend it to his last breath, but he has sworn to fight for the good of the realm since the beginning. He is the shield. He stands between Westeros and its threats. He doesn’t just stand for the North, for Winterfell.

Jon is far more selfless than that. He cares about the people of Westeros, he tried his best to convince Cersei and Dany to fight alongside him because everyone will die if they don’t band together. It’s not just the North. He’s trying to save them all.

blog.name: jonsa101
blog.title: Jonsa101
blog.description: #Jonsa and #Sharpwin Meta Writer. Pop Culture Obsessed. Lover of Street Style.

summary:
But why on earth would the show have Sansa looking like this:
Where everyone and their mama take notice and can’t stop talking...
body:
I’m Sorry I Still Can’t Wrap My Mind Around This and I Promise I’m Not Trying To Be Petty

But why on earth would the show have Sansa looking like this:

Where everyone and their mama take notice and can’t stop talking about how beautiful Sansa looks and then have Dany looking like this:

With an outfit everyone knows is ill fitted and makes Daenerys look frumpy! To add insult to injury they made her wear a damn ascot! Instead of looking like Jon’s lover her ass is actually looking like his aunt!

If Dany is supposed to be the YMBQ and victorious in her quest for the Iron Throne, why on earth would the show literally give her the worst outfit she’s ever had on this show in the season that matters the most! Throughout the series Daenerys has probably had some of the best outfits on the show. They flattered her and made her look incredibly beautiful. But this outfit is a complete mess and if anything, Dany’s outfit is supposed to fucking slay this season!!

It doesn’t make sense! Unless…..

There is a narrative purpose for this. Maybe just maybe Dany’s outfit reflects the type of season she’s going to have. The same goes with Sansa. Maybe the reason why Sansa looks beautiful, confident and sexy all at the same time is because Sansa is about to glow up and truly blossom into her own and who she’s supposed to be in season 8.

My last point is this. Is it by accident that they’re making Sansa look exceptionally beautiful while Jon’s around?! I don’t think so. We’ve had two clips now where Jon can’t seem to take his eyes off of his sister/cousin even while Dany is right next to him. So yeah…. I’m just gonna leave it at that.

*Also this is in no way comparing how beautiful Sophie Turner and Emilia Clarke are! They are both stunners! I’m simply making an observation pertaining to the characters and the outfit/look choices the show runners purposely chose for them this season!

summary: starklings names:  brandon “bran” stark: mythic. brandon “bran the builder” stark is a legendary figure from the age of heroes....
body:
starklings names:

brandon “bran” stark:

mythic. brandon “bran the builder” stark is a legendary figure from the age of heroes. he is the founder of house stark and builder of winterfell as well as several other key structures (allegedly). its the classic name for stark kings. 

jon snow:

common. its like the jon smith of westeros. it doesnt get less noble than that. however his true name is aegon targaryen (I GUESS???) which has significant historical value. its a name for conquerors and kings. 

arya stark

unique. there’s only one arya stark. arya’s first name is taken from her great great grandmother who was a flint. but among the starks arya is the first to bear that name (officially). arya isn’t following in anyone’s footsteps. she’s one of a kind.

tags: but Jonsa shippers push me closer and closer
summary: Now before I start this; I don’t care if you ship Jonerys or not. My self: I don’t ship it. But I love how their stories are...
body:
Now before I start this; I don’t care if you ship Jonerys or not. My self: I don’t ship it. But I love how their stories are intertwined and parallel each other. Also that I hate Jonsa and the shippers and the way they’ve just barged their way into this Fandom and treated everyone like trash. So if I must pick a side in the ship war they started it’s definitely Jonerys.

We’ll start with “political!Jon” which at first I thought it was just Jon being political, but apparently not ahaha. It’s Jon lying to Dany?

1| “Jon is lying to Daenerys / using her”

The argument for this is that Jon has been using Daenerys for her dragons and armies. They say this with weight because of when Jon went undercover with the Wildlings and lied to Ygritte. But there’s something they don’t say; something they conveniently left out:

Jon was kidnapped, he had to lie to get out of the situation he was in with the Wildlings. Jon did what he had to do then. But, Jon willingly went to Dragonstone. Willingly told Daenerys everything; telling her he was King before kneeling. Willginly bent the knee.

The difference between these situations; free will and willingness.

But let’s get further into this: Daenerys is obviously pregnant. They dropped a ridiculously amount of foreshadowing throughout S7. So this… political!Jon would just do this to the mother of his child?

Also let’s not forget that “he loved her — she loved him” played over them. Speaking about the past and the present. You don’t need to be a qualified brain surgeon to understand what they’re laying down here.

But this theory is onto something… There’s definitely a betrayer with Stark blood. They just don’t have brunette hair ;). Whoops!

2| “Blood”

Nice way to say incest.

But it’s funny, really. This one always cracks me up.

They say that Jon will leave Daenerys when he finds out she’s his aunt, and will then get together with Sansa - who’s his cousin; someone who he thought was his sister his entire life, and vice versa.

You’ll criticise Jonerys for being incest on one hand, but praise Jonsa on the other?

——————

That being said: if you just dislike Jonerys for the incest but also hate Jonsa as well, then that’s perfectly understandable; I understand why you will not like Jonerys.

This is merely just me poking holes in Jonsa’s hate towards Jonerys. It’s not about the average persons justified reason to hate something like incest; so you, average person, I hope you have a good day :) this isn’t being directed at you.

3| “the Iron Throne; Northern Independence”

Since Dany wants to sit on the Throne, as she believe she’s the rightful heir, and that Jon; who doesn’t know this, is the actual rightful heir.

Of course this stems from them wanting Jon as king and Sansa as his queen, so there’ll hate Jonerys (and Dany too; but I already made a post about all the Dany hate). That being said;

It’s not like Jon and Dany would be differing ideals. Jon wants independence for the North. Dany wants to break the wheel of power. That could bring in; independence for each kingdom, but living under one government (with Jon and Dany on top). Sort of like the Commonwealth, with the UK / Australia / New Zealand / the other ones. All their own countries, just under one umbrella.

Also, Dany has said in the books, when finding out Aegon (Young Griff) is alive, she wanted to rule with him together.

4| “Fan Service”

I remember this one two years ago during Season 7.

While yes S7 seemed a bit rushed. Because it had to be, to say Jonerys is nothing but fan service is lunacy…

GRRM has told D&D what happens; he’s told D&D how it ends, who dies, everything; because the books won’t be finished until like 2097. Do you really think they would have just added in Jonerys for the lols?

Of course not. This has been coming for well over 22 years.

One good look at the characters and what they’ve been through you’ll see that they circle around each other. They have been paralleling each other for years. Their meeting, and joining was something that was unavoidable.

———

———

That’s really all I can think of at this point, of course I’m running on fumes; lol I love insomnia.

There is definitely more but can’t think rn

But yeah, this all seems to come from the crackship that was born from Season 6. Thus creating a fandom so toxic it has made Chernobyl more a habitable place to be than being in this Fandom.

But, again; I don’t care if you ship it or not. That’s irrelevant to me. Just thought I’d take a few arguments, voiced by Jonsa’s, and poke holes in them.

Per usual: anti Jonerys folk / Jonsa shippers — don’t interact. No point arguing when we’ll never see eye to eye.

reblog.comment:

I remember this one two years ago during Season 7.

While yes S7 seemed a bit rushed. Because it had to be, to say Jonerys is nothing but fan service is lunacy…

GRRM has told D&D what happens; he’s told D&D how it ends, who dies, everything; because the books won’t be finished until like 2097. Do you really think they would have just added in Jonerys for the lols?

Of course not. This has been coming for well over 22 years.

One good look at the characters and what they’ve been through you’ll see that they circle around each other. They have been paralleling each other for years. Their meeting, and joining was something that was unavoidable.

———

———

That’s really all I can think of at this point, of course I’m running on fumes; lol I love insomnia.

There is definitely more but can’t think rn

But yeah, this all seems to come from the crackship that was born from Season 6. Thus creating a fandom so toxic it has made Chernobyl more a habitable place to be than being in this Fandom.

But, again; I don’t care if you ship it or not. That’s irrelevant to me. Just thought I’d take a few arguments, voiced by Jonsa’s, and poke holes in them.

Per usual: anti Jonerys folk / Jonsa shippers — don’t interact. No point arguing when we’ll never see eye to eye.

trail.content_raw:
Now before I start this; I don’t care if you ship Jonerys or not. My self: I don’t ship it. But I love how their stories are intertwined and parallel each other. Also that I hate Jonsa and the shippers and the way they’ve just barged their way into this Fandom and treated everyone like trash. So if I must pick a side in the ship war they started it’s definitely Jonerys.

We’ll start with “political!Jon” which at first I thought it was just Jon being political, but apparently not ahaha. It’s Jon lying to Dany?

1| “Jon is lying to Daenerys / using her”

The argument for this is that Jon has been using Daenerys for her dragons and armies. They say this with weight because of when Jon went undercover with the Wildlings and lied to Ygritte. But there’s something they don’t say; something they conveniently left out:

Jon was kidnapped, he had to lie to get out of the situation he was in with the Wildlings. Jon did what he had to do then. But, Jon willingly went to Dragonstone. Willingly told Daenerys everything; telling her he was King before kneeling. Willginly bent the knee.

The difference between these situations; free will and willingness.

But let’s get further into this: Daenerys is obviously pregnant. They dropped a ridiculously amount of foreshadowing throughout S7. So this… political!Jon would just do this to the mother of his child?

Also let’s not forget that “he loved her — she loved him” played over them. Speaking about the past and the present. You don’t need to be a qualified brain surgeon to understand what they’re laying down here.

But this theory is onto something… There’s definitely a betrayer with Stark blood. They just don’t have brunette hair ;). Whoops!

2| “Blood”

Nice way to say incest.

But it’s funny, really. This one always cracks me up.

They say that Jon will leave Daenerys when he finds out she’s his aunt, and will then get together with Sansa - who’s his cousin; someone who he thought was his sister his entire life, and vice versa.

You’ll criticise Jonerys for being incest on one hand, but praise Jonsa on the other?

——————

That being said: if you just dislike Jonerys for the incest but also hate Jonsa as well, then that’s perfectly understandable; I understand why you will not like Jonerys.

This is merely just me poking holes in Jonsa’s hate towards Jonerys. It’s not about the average persons justified reason to hate something like incest; so you, average person, I hope you have a good day :) this isn’t being directed at you.

3| “the Iron Throne; Northern Independence”

Since Dany wants to sit on the Throne, as she believe she’s the rightful heir, and that Jon; who doesn’t know this, is the actual rightful heir.

Of course this stems from them wanting Jon as king and Sansa as his queen, so there’ll hate Jonerys (and Dany too; but I already made a post about all the Dany hate). That being said;

It’s not like Jon and Dany would be differing ideals. Jon wants independence for the North. Dany wants to break the wheel of power. That could bring in; independence for each kingdom, but living under one government (with Jon and Dany on top). Sort of like the Commonwealth, with the UK / Australia / New Zealand / the other ones. All their own countries, just under one umbrella.

Also, Dany has said in the books, when finding out Aegon (Young Griff) is alive, she wanted to rule with him together.

4| “Fan Service”

I remember this one two years ago during Season 7.

While yes S7 seemed a bit rushed. Because it had to be, to say Jonerys is nothing but fan service is lunacy…

GRRM has told D&D what happens; he’s told D&D how it ends, who dies, everything; because the books won’t be finished until like 2097. Do you really think they would have just added in Jonerys for the lols?

Of course not. This has been coming for well over 22 years.

One good look at the characters and what they’ve been through you’ll see that they circle around each other. They have been paralleling each other for years. Their meeting, and joining was something that was unavoidable.

———

———

That’s really all I can think of at this point, of course I’m running on fumes; lol I love insomnia.

There is definitely more but can’t think rn

But yeah, this all seems to come from the crackship that was born from Season 6. Thus creating a fandom so toxic it has made Chernobyl more a habitable place to be than being in this Fandom.

But, again; I don’t care if you ship it or not. That’s irrelevant to me. Just thought I’d take a few arguments, voiced by Jonsa’s, and poke holes in them.

Per usual: anti Jonerys folk / Jonsa shippers — don’t interact. No point arguing when we’ll never see eye to eye.

title: Fire and Ice - burning_ice_got - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 12/?
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV)
Rating: Mature
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen, Arya Stark/Gendry Waters, Euron Greyjoy/Cersei Lannister
Characters: Daenerys Targaryen, Jon Snow, Bran Stark, Sansa Stark, Arya Stark, Tyrion Lannister, Jorah Mormont, Varys (ASoIaF), Gendry Waters, Samwell Tarly, Jaime Lannister, Bronn (ASoIaF), Sandor Clegane, Gregor Clegane, Euron Greyjoy, Cersei Lannister, Harry Strickland, Alys Karstark, Yohn Royce, Lyanna Mormont, Robett Glover, Robin Arryn, Brienne of Tarth, Davos Seaworth, Missandei (ASoIaF), Grey Worm, Theon Greyjoy, Yara Greyjoy, Melisandre of Asshai, Kinvara (Game of Thrones), Night King (Game of Thrones), Tormund Giantsbane, Edd Tollett, Beric Dondarrion, Maester Wolkan
Additional Tags: Love, War, Smut, Death, Drama, Tragedy, Thriller, Fantasy, Killing, Sacrifice, Honor, Family, Duty, Winter, Night Terrors, Angst, Heartbreaking, Truth, Dragons, Wights, Lions, Wolves, Past, Pain, Snow, Jon Snow is a Targaryen, Eventual Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen, Incest
Summary:

Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen set sail for Winterfell. The king can’t fight his feelings for her anymore and decides to let them loose. Despite the great danger and their responsibilities as king and queen, both yield to each other consumed by love. The Great War is coming and painful truths are ascertained. Will their love defy the cruel destiny and fight down death?

“When you play the game of thrones, you win or you die. There is no middle ground.” - Cersei Lannister

body:
At This Point

I don’t care if Jon and Dany sit on the Iron Throne. I don’t care if they spend the rest of their lives milking cows and weaving baskets. I just want them to be happy together with their babies.

I am 26, Leo Sun Sagittarius Rising and Cancer Moon, INFP. Chaotic Neutral. Ambivert. I am Aroace, Autistic and have Cerebral Palsy. Slytherin, Plague Rat, Inmate W25Z,  Swiftie. Gray Jedi. My blog is Multifandom, Social Justice, Doctor Who, Harry Potter, ASOIAF, Star Wars, Star Trek, Stranger Things, Life Is Strange, Orphan Black, Carmilla, WWE, Marvel, DC, LOTR, Buffy, Hannibal, Horror, Emilie Autumn, Taylor Swift, Halsey, Lorde, and other music and whatever I post!

summary: I stopped watching Game Of Thrones after season 4 because of the way Dorne, Sansa and the Ironborn were treated, but even I KNOW...
body:
I stopped watching Game Of Thrones after season 4 because of the way Dorne, Sansa and the Ironborn were treated, but even I KNOW season 7 would be improved if Sansa was the one who went to treat with Dany. Why?

  • Sansa is smarter
  • Jon does not even want to be king. So maybe reverse season 6′s finale and make Sansa queen or have Jon declare for Sansa
  • Sansa before leaving would warn Jon and Davos not to trust Littlefinger and if he tries anything to hurt their family, kill him(if any of you who ship Sansa with the architect of her suffering are reading this, this post is not for you) 
  • Brienne would’ve been with Sansa(unlikely because of The Last Jedi, but fuck that, they did nothing but waste Gwendoline’s talent)
  • Jon would reunite with Arya and Jon would reunite with Bran
  • Dany and Sansa would bond over their shared trauma and understand each other
  • Jon would be trying to come up with proof that Littlefinger betrayed Ned and Cat, in the hope that Ned would be avenged and that Cat would finally forgive him for being Ned’s bastard
  • Sansa and Dany would be friendly and closer than Jon and Dany as Sophie and Emilia would actually have chemistry
  • Dany would not be constantly telling Sansa to bend the knee, instead they are equals. Queen to queen. 
  • Sansa and Dany would be hearteyeing each other.
  • Sansa will tell her that she has the North’s support and her unyielding support as long as she lives
  • As we know Bran knows about Littlefinger’s schemes in the past, but Bran would have a vision of a flashback showing Cersei and Littlefinger. Cersei telling him about the Red Wedding and asking if he wants Catelyn to be taken prisoner. He will say “why have her when I can have a younger and more beautiful Cat?” Now you might be thinking “but Petyr said he killed Joffrey because he killed Cat” and he’s told a whole bunch of lies throughout the series. Littlefinger has shown little care in the books that Cat died and sees Sansa as a better version of Cat. So it makes sense that he would show no emotion to Cat’s death as long as he can have Sansa.
  • Sansa will warn Dany not to trust Cersei. 
    “Cersei held me hostage, she thought I was naive but she never realized while she was demeaning me, I was learning everything from her.”
  • We would see Brienne reunite with Tormund and hilarity ensues.
  • When Jaime arrives, Brienne would talk some sense into him and with Sansa there, Jaime remembers his oath to Catelyn Stark. Jaime would abandon Cersei and join Sansa and Dany
  • As Jaime pledges his oath to the queens. Dany asks why he killed her father. Jaime gives her the same confession that he gave Brienne. And Dany says “as queen, I pardon you of the crime of kingslaying” forgiveness from Dany and Jaime is finally finds closure
  • When the proof is presented to the North, Jon executes Littlefinger
  • Jon reunites with Sam
  • Sansa and Dany’s final scene is a passionate and emotional kiss(better than a passionless boat sex scene with no chemistry). Two queens joined together. The Queen In The North and The Dragon Queen
  • Instead of Bran telling Sam about Jon’s parentage. Bran tells Jon and we see his reaction

  • Jon would reunite with Arya and Jon would reunite with Bran
  • Dany and Sansa would bond over their shared trauma and understand each other
  • Jon would be trying to come up with proof that Littlefinger betrayed Ned and Cat, in the hope that Ned would be avenged and that Cat would finally forgive him for being Ned’s bastard
  • Sansa and Dany would be friendly and closer than Jon and Dany as Sophie and Emilia would actually have chemistry
  • Dany would not be constantly telling Sansa to bend the knee, instead they are equals. Queen to queen. 
  • Sansa and Dany would be hearteyeing each other.
  • Sansa will tell her that she has the North’s support and her unyielding support as long as she lives
  • As we know Bran knows about Littlefinger’s schemes in the past, but Bran would have a vision of a flashback showing Cersei and Littlefinger. Cersei telling him about the Red Wedding and asking if he wants Catelyn to be taken prisoner. He will say “why have her when I can have a younger and more beautiful Cat?” Now you might be thinking “but Petyr said he killed Joffrey because he killed Cat” and he’s told a whole bunch of lies throughout the series. Littlefinger has shown little care in the books that Cat died and sees Sansa as a better version of Cat. So it makes sense that he would show no emotion to Cat’s death as long as he can have Sansa.
  • Sansa will warn Dany not to trust Cersei. 
    “Cersei held me hostage, she thought I was naive but she never realized while she was demeaning me, I was learning everything from her.”
  • We would see Brienne reunite with Tormund and hilarity ensues.
  • When Jaime arrives, Brienne would talk some sense into him and with Sansa there, Jaime remembers his oath to Catelyn Stark. Jaime would abandon Cersei and join Sansa and Dany
  • As Jaime pledges his oath to the queens. Dany asks why he killed her father. Jaime gives her the same confession that he gave Brienne. And Dany says “as queen, I pardon you of the crime of kingslaying” forgiveness from Dany and Jaime is finally finds closure
  • When the proof is presented to the North, Jon executes Littlefinger
  • Jon reunites with Sam
  • Sansa and Dany’s final scene is a passionate and emotional kiss(better than a passionless boat sex scene with no chemistry). Two queens joined together. The Queen In The North and The Dragon Queen
  • Instead of Bran telling Sam about Jon’s parentage. Bran tells Jon and we see his reaction
trail.content:
I stopped watching Game Of Thrones after season 4 because of the way Dorne, Sansa and the Ironborn were treated, but even I KNOW season 7 would be improved if Sansa was the one who went to treat with Dany. Why?

  • Sansa is smarter
  • Jon does not even want to be king. So maybe reverse season 6′s finale and make Sansa queen or have Jon declare for Sansa
  • Sansa before leaving would warn Jon and Davos not to trust Littlefinger and if he tries anything to hurt their family, kill him(if any of you who ship Sansa with the architect of her suffering are reading this, this post is not for you) 
  • Brienne would’ve been with Sansa(unlikely because of The Last Jedi, but fuck that, they did nothing but waste Gwendoline’s talent)
  • Jon would reunite with Arya and Jon would reunite with Bran
  • Dany and Sansa would bond over their shared trauma and understand each other
  • Jon would be trying to come up with proof that Littlefinger betrayed Ned and Cat, in the hope that Ned would be avenged and that Cat would finally forgive him for being Ned’s bastard
  • Sansa and Dany would be friendly and closer than Jon and Dany as Sophie and Emilia would actually have chemistry
  • Dany would not be constantly telling Sansa to bend the knee, instead they are equals. Queen to queen. 
  • Sansa and Dany would be hearteyeing each other.
  • Sansa will tell her that she has the North’s support and her unyielding support as long as she lives
  • As we know Bran knows about Littlefinger’s schemes in the past, but Bran would have a vision of a flashback showing Cersei and Littlefinger. Cersei telling him about the Red Wedding and asking if he wants Catelyn to be taken prisoner. He will say “why have her when I can have a younger and more beautiful Cat?” Now you might be thinking “but Petyr said he killed Joffrey because he killed Cat” and he’s told a whole bunch of lies throughout the series. Littlefinger has shown little care in the books that Cat died and sees Sansa as a better version of Cat. So it makes sense that he would show no emotion to Cat’s death as long as he can have Sansa.
  • Sansa will warn Dany not to trust Cersei. 
    “Cersei held me hostage, she thought I was naive but she never realized while she was demeaning me, I was learning everything from her.”
  • We would see Brienne reunite with Tormund and hilarity ensues.
  • When Jaime arrives, Brienne would talk some sense into him and with Sansa there, Jaime remembers his oath to Catelyn Stark. Jaime would abandon Cersei and join Sansa and Dany
  • As Jaime pledges his oath to the queens. Dany asks why he killed her father. Jaime gives her the same confession that he gave Brienne. And Dany says “as queen, I pardon you of the crime of kingslaying” forgiveness from Dany and Jaime is finally finds closure
  • When the proof is presented to the North, Jon executes Littlefinger
  • Jon reunites with Sam
  • Sansa and Dany’s final scene is a passionate and emotional kiss(better than a passionless boat sex scene with no chemistry). Two queens joined together. The Queen In The North and The Dragon Queen
  • Instead of Bran telling Sam about Jon’s parentage. Bran tells Jon and we see his reaction
